In health IT, hardest thing #4: sniping from incumbents who use fear about  "quality" and "compliance" to knock down new, better ideas
In health IT, hardest thing #3: lure of large, early contracts with mega entities whose custom/complex needs don't match the broad market
In health IT, hardest thing #2: to get people who move the needle $-wise to care; vs. an abstract ROI that doesn't address a real pain point
In health IT, hardest thing #1: to get up-to-date IT innovators to work with actual operators. More often: IT c.2005, working in isolation.
